title: Table
description: A `Table` entity organizes data in rows and columns and is defined in a `Database Schema`.

profileSampleType.description: Type of Profile Sample (percentage or rows)

tableType.description: This schema defines the type used for describing different types of tables.

dataType.description: This enum defines the type of data stored in a column.

constraint.description: This enum defines the type for column constraint.

tableConstraint.title: TableConstraint
tableConstraint.description: This enum defines the type for table constraint.

columns.description: List of column names corresponding to the constraint.

referredColumns.description: List of referred columns for the constraint.

columnName.description: Local name (not fully qualified name) of the column. ColumnName is `-` when the column is not named in struct dataType. For example, BigQuery supports struct with unnamed fields.

tablePartition.description: This schema defines the partition column of a table and format the partition is created.

columns.description: List of column partitions with their type and interval.

partitionColumnDetails.description: This schema defines the partition column of a table and format the partition is created.

columnName.description: List of column names corresponding to the partition.

interval.description: partition interval , example hourly, daily, monthly.

column.description: This schema defines the type for a column in a table.

displayName.description: Display Name that identifies this column name.

dataType.description: Data type of the column (int, date etc.).

arrayDataType.description: Data type used array in dataType. For example, `array<int>` has dataType as `array` and arrayDataType as `int`.

dataLength.description: Length of `char`, `varchar`, `binary`, `varbinary` `dataTypes`, else null. For example, `varchar(20)` has dataType as `varchar` and dataLength as `20`.

precision.description: The precision of a numeric is the total count of significant digits in the whole number, that is, the number of digits to both sides of the decimal point. Precision is applicable Integer types, such as `INT`, `SMALLINT`, `BIGINT`, etc. It also applies to other Numeric types, such as `NUMBER`, `DECIMAL`, `DOUBLE`, `FLOAT`, etc.

scale.description: The scale of a numeric is the count of decimal digits in the fractional part, to the right of the decimal point. For Integer types, the scale is `0`. It mainly applies to non Integer Numeric types, such as `NUMBER`, `DECIMAL`, `DOUBLE`, `FLOAT`, etc.

dataTypeDisplay.description: Display name used for dataType. This is useful for complex types, such as `array<int>`, `map<int,string>`, `struct<>`, and union types.

jsonSchema.description: Json schema only if the dataType is JSON else null.

children.description: Child columns if dataType or arrayDataType is `map`, `struct`, or `union` else `null`.

profile.description: Latest Data profile for a Column.

customMetrics.description: List of Custom Metrics registered for a table.

joinedWith.description: Fully qualified names of the fields/entities that this field/entity is joined with.

columnJoins.description: This schema defines the type to capture how frequently a column is joined with columns in the other tables.

joinedWith.description: Fully qualified names of the columns that this column is joined with.

tableJoins.description: This schema defines the type to capture information about how this table is joined with other tables and columns.

startDate.description: Date can be only from today going back to last 29 days.

directTableJoins.description: Joins with other tables that are not on a specific column (e.g: UNION join)

tableData.description: This schema defines the type to capture rows of sample data for a table.

columns.description: List of local column names (not fully qualified column names) of the table.

rows.description: Data for multiple rows of the table.

items.description: Data for a single row of the table within the same order as columns fields.

customMetricProfile.description: Profiling results of a Custom Metric.

columnProfile.description: This schema defines the type to capture the table's column profile.

timestamp.description: Timestamp on which profile is taken.

valuesCount.description: Total count of the values in this column.

valuesPercentage.description: Percentage of values in this column with respect to row count.

validCount.description: Total count of valid values in this column.

duplicateCount.description: No.of Rows that contain duplicates in a column.

nullCount.description: No.of null values in a column.

nullProportion.description: No.of null value proportion in columns.

missingPercentage.description: Missing Percentage is calculated by taking percentage of validCount/valuesCount.

missingCount.description: Missing count is calculated by subtracting valuesCount - validCount.

uniqueCount.description: No. of unique values in the column.

uniqueProportion.description: Proportion of number of unique values in a column.

distinctCount.description: Number of values that contain distinct values.

distinctProportion.description: Proportion of distinct values in a column.

minLength.description: Minimum string length in a column.

maxLength.description: Maximum string length in a column.

interQuartileRange.description: Inter quartile range of a column.

nonParametricSkew.description: Non parametric skew of a column.

customMetrics.description: Custom Metrics profile list bound to a column.

dmlOperationType.description: This schema defines the type of DML operation.

systemProfile.description: This schema defines the System Profile object holding profile data from system tables.

timestamp.description: Timestamp on which profile is taken.

columnProfilerConfig.description: This schema defines the type for Table profile config include Columns.

columnName.description: Column Name of the table to be included.

partitionProfilerConfig.description: This schema defines the partition configuration used by profiler.

partitionColumnName.description: name of the column to use for the partition

partitionInterval.description: The interval to use for the partitioning

partitionIntervalUnit.description: unit used for the partition interval

partitionValues.description: unit used for the partition interval

partitionIntegerRangeStart.description: start of the integer range for partitioning

partitionIntegerRangeEnd.description: end of the integer range for partitioning

tableProfilerConfig.description: This schema defines the type for Table profile config.

profileSample.description: Percentage of data or no. of rows we want to execute the profiler and tests on

sampleDataCount.description: Number of row of sample data to be generated
sampleDataCount.title: Sample Data Rows Count

profileQuery.description: Users' raw SQL query to fetch sample data and profile the table

excludeColumns.description: column names to exclude from profiling.

includeColumns.description: Only run profiler on included columns with specific metrics.

tableProfile.description: This schema defines the type to capture the table's data profile.

timestamp.description: Timestamp on which profile is taken.

profileSample.description: Percentage of data or no. of rows we want to execute the profiler and tests on

rowCount.description: No.of rows in the table. This is always executed on the whole table.

customMetrics.description: Custom Metrics profile list bound to a column.

modelType.$comment: Currently only DBT model type is supported

dataModel.description: This captures information about how the table is modeled. Currently only DBT model is supported.

description.description: Description of the Table from the model.

rawSql.description: This corresponds to rws SQL from `<model_name>.sql` in DBT. This might be null when SQL query need not be compiled as done in DBT.

sql.description: This corresponds to compile SQL from `<model_name>.sql` in DBT. In cases where compilation is not necessary, this corresponds to SQL that created the table.

upstream.description: Fully qualified name of Models/tables used for in `sql` for creating this table.

columns.description: Columns from the schema defined during modeling. In case of DBT, the metadata here comes from `schema.yaml`.

fileFormat.description: File format in case of file/datalake tables.

id.description: Unique identifier of this table instance.

name.description: Name of a table. Expected to be unique within a database.

displayName.description: Display Name that identifies this table. It could be title or label from the source services.

fullyQualifiedName.description: Fully qualified name of a table in the form `serviceName.databaseName.tableName`.

updatedAt.description: Last update time corresponding to the new version of the entity in Unix epoch time milliseconds.

databaseSchema.description: Reference to database schema that contains this table.

database.description: Reference to Database that contains this table.

service.description: Link to Database service this table is hosted in.

serviceType.description: Service type this table is hosted in.

location.description: Reference to the Location that contains this table.

viewDefinition.description: View Definition in SQL. Applies to TableType.View only.

usageSummary.description: Latest usage information for this table.

joins.description: Details of other tables this table is frequently joined with.

tableProfilerConfig.description: Table Profiler Config to include or exclude columns from profiling.

customMetrics.description: List of Custom Metrics registered for a table.

profile.description: Latest Data profile for a table.

testSuite.description: Executable test suite associated with this table

dataModel.description: This captures information about how the table is modeled. Currently only DBT model is supported.

changeDescription.description: Change that lead to this version of the entity.

deleted.description: When `true` indicates the entity has been soft deleted.

retentionPeriod.description: Retention period of the data in the table. Period is expressed as duration in ISO 8601 format in UTC. Example - `P23DT23H`. When not set, the retention period is inherited from the parent database schema, if it exists.

extension.description: Entity extension data with custom attributes added to the entity.

domain.description: Domain the table belongs to. When not set, the table inherits the domain from the database schema it belongs to.

dataProducts.description: List of data products this entity is part of.

fileFormat.description: File format in case of file/datalake tables.
